snippet: Bill de Blasio left little doubt that he would be overseeing an administration vastly different from the one he will succeed, describing his liberal social plans as a “sacred mission.”
abstract: Bill de Blasio, after winning New York City mayoral election, leaves little doubt that he will oversee vastly different administration than his predecessor Michael R Bloomberg; de Blasio, who spends a cordial if awkward hour with the man he will soon replace, describes his liberal social plans as 'sacred mission' crucial to future of city he will run.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and KATE TAYLOR

lead_paragraph: Bill de Blasio left little doubt that he would be overseeing an administration vastly different from the one he will succeed, describing his liberal social plans as a “sacred mission.”

headline.main: De Blasio, Preparing to Become Mayor, Signals Sea Change in New York
headline.print_headline: De Blasio, at City Hall, Points to a Sea Change
